meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unfriendly or unsuitable
meanings.sent1: The uncongeniality between the two neighbors was evident in their constant arguments.
meanings.sent2: The uncongeniality of the weather made it difficult to enjoy the outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent3: Despite their uncongeniality, they managed to work together on the project.
meanings.sent4: The uncongeniality in the room was so thick you could cut it with a knife.
meanings.sent5: The uncongeniality of the situation left everyone feeling uncomfortable and unwelcome.

meanings.sent1: The uncongeniality in the band's performance was noticeable to the audience.
meanings.sent2: The uncongeniality between their opinions led to a heated debate.
meanings.sent3: The uncongeniality of colors in her outfit made it hard to look away.
meanings.sent4: The uncongeniality of the conflicting ideas created tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The uncongeniality of the music clashed with the peaceful atmosphere of the park.

meanings.definition: A feeling of dislike or aversion
meanings.sent1: She couldn't hide her uncongeniality towards the new student in class.
meanings.sent2: The uncongeniality she felt towards broccoli made it hard for her to eat it.
meanings.sent3: His uncongeniality towards horror movies was evident in his refusal to watch them.
meanings.sent4: The uncongeniality towards public speaking made her nervous before the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The uncongeniality towards change made him resistant to trying new things.
